The First Chapter
Ekavihārin
Whether in front or behind,
if there is no one else,
it is very comfortable
for one living alone in the forest.
So I will go alone
to the wilderness praised by the Buddha;
it is comfortable for one living alone,
for a monk who is ardent.
Delightful and inspiring for the meditator,
frequented by wild elephants,
I will quickly enter the forest alone,
master of myself.
In the cool grove in full bloom,
in a cool mountain cave,
having sprinkled my limbs,
I will walk alone in meditation.
Alone, without a companion,
in a delightful great forest,
when will I dwell
with my work done, without pollutants?
May this intention of mine,
who wishes to do this, be fulfilled;
I will accomplish it myself,
no one else is the doer for another.
I will put on this armor
and enter the forest;
I will not come out from there
until I attain the destruction of the pollutants.🔽In the cool breeze blowing,
cool and fragrant,
I will break through ignorance,
